import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
# Fill missing age with median
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing fare with median
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing cabin with mode (most frequent)
X['Cabin'].fillna(X['Cabin'].mode()[0] if not X['Cabin'].mode().empty else 'Unknown', inplace=True)

# Fill missing embarked with mode
X['Embarked'].fillna(X['Embarked'].mode()[0] if not X['Embarked'].mode().empty else 'S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X = pd.get_dummies(X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Prepare test data
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Fill missing values in test data similarly
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Cabin'].fillna(test_X['Cabin'].mode()[0] if not test_X['Cabin'].mode().empty else 'Unknown', inplace=True)
test_X['Embarked'].fillna(test_X['Embarked'].mode()[0] if not test_X['Embarked'].mode().empty else 'S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables in test data
test_X['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_X['Sex'])

# One-hot encode test data
test_X = pd.get_dummies(test_X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure all columns are aligned
X_cols = X.columns.tolist()
test_X = test_X.reindex(columns=X

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Drop Name, Ticket, and Cabin columns as they are not useful for prediction
X = X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_X = test_X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
# Fill missing age with median
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing fare with median
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Fill missing embarked with mode
X['Embarked'].fillna(X['Embarked'].mode()[0] if not X['Embarked'].mode().empty else 'S', inplace=True)
test_X['Embarked'].fillna(test_X['Embarked'].mode()[0] if not test_X['Embarked'].mode().empty else 'S', inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
test_X['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_X['Sex'])

# One-hot encode categorical variables
X = pd.get_dummies(X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)
test_X = pd.get_dummies(test_X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure all columns are aligned
X_cols = X.columns.tolist()
test_X = test_X.reindex(columns=X_cols, fill_value=0)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict on test data
predictions = model.predict(test_X)

# Create submission DataFrame
submission

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Create new features
X['FamilySize'] = X['SibSp'] + X['Parch'] + 1
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_X['FamilySize'] = test_X['SibSp'] + test_X['Parch'] + 1

# Age groups (bins)
age_bins = [0, 12, 18, 35, 60, 100]
age_labels = ['Child', 'Teen', 'Young Adult', 'Adult', 'Senior']
X['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(X['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)
test_X['AgeGroup'] = pd.cut(test_X['Age'], bins=age_bins, labels=age_labels, right=False)

# Fare per family
X['FarePerFamily'] = X['Fare'] / X['FamilySize']
test_X['FarePerFamily'] = test_X['Fare'] / test_X['FamilySize']

# Is alone
X['IsAlone'] = (X['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)
test_X['IsAlone'] = (test_X['FamilySize'] == 1).astype(int)

# Drop original columns
X = X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_X = test_X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
test_X['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_X['Sex'])

# Encode AgeGroup
X['AgeGroup'] = X['AgeGroup'].astype('category').cat.codes
test_X['AgeGroup'] = test_X['AgeGroup'].astype('category').cat.codes

# One-hot encode Embarked
X = pd.get_dummies(X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)
test_X = pd.get_dummies(test_X, columns=['Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure all columns are aligned
X_cols = X.columns.tolist()
test_X = test_X.reindex(columns=X_cols, fill_value=0)

# Han
